instructions.text:
BOH4M

1.5 Classical Management Approaches

Make a copy of this document



Learning Goals:

  • You will classical management approaches  

  • You will discuss scientific management, administrative principles and bureaucratic organization through an infographic

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Ontario Curriculum Expectation

A1. Assess the role of management within an organization’

A1.1 Identify the characteristics of an organiza­tion (e.g., purpose, division of labour, hier­archy of authority); 

A1.2 evaluate the different levels of management with respect to roles, responsibilities, activ­ities, skills, and competencies; 

A1.3 evaluate major management theories and practices (e.g., classical, behavioural, quan­titative approach, systems theories; total quality management)



Instructions

Step 1:

Fill in the table with full sentences based on what you learned in the lesson.

Scientific Management

Definition

Example

Weber’s Bureaucracy

Definition

Example

Fayol’s Administrative Principles

Definition

Example

Step 3: 

Create an infographic with the theme “Classical Management Approach”. It can be digitally made through canva, piktochart or any software of your choice. Use pictures or graphics to make it attractive. Insert your picture in the box provided below.




Step 4: Review

Read through your work before submitting it for marking. Use the provided rubrics below as a guide in editing and finalizing your work.

Step 5: Submit

Upload a copy of your work on your shared course folder.




Rubric


Student Name:

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge and Understanding: How well did you show your understanding of the content of required tasks and include specified elements? How well did you demonstrate your knowledge of classical management approaches?

Demonstrates limited understanding of content of required tasks and includes few of the specified elements.

Demonstrates some understanding of content of required tasks and includes some of the specified elements.

Demonstrates considerable understanding of content of required tasks and includes most of the specified elements.

Demonstrates thorough understanding of content of required tasks and includes all of the specified elements.



Demonstrates limited knowledge of classical management approaches.

Demonstrates some knowledge of classical management approaches.

Demonstrates considerable knowledge of classical management approaches.

Demonstrates thorough knowledge of classical management approaches.

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your critical and creative thinking skills by presenting the meaning, and adding information, in creative ways when presenting your Performance Task?

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with limited use and effectiveness in showing the roles of classical management approaches.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with moderate effectiveness in showing the roles of classical management approaches.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with considerable effectiveness in showing the roles of classical management approaches.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with a high degree of effectiveness in showing the roles of classical management approaches.



Communication: How well did you communicate your information and ideas by using language effectively to convey meaning; by using a form of presentation to effectively communicate with the audience?

Communicates information and ideas with limited clarity.

Communicates information and ideas with some clarity.

Communicates information and ideas with considerable clarity

Communicates information and ideas with a high degree of clarity.



Uses language with limited accuracy and effectiveness.

Uses language with some accuracy and effectiveness.

Uses language with considerable accuracy and effectiveness. 

Uses language with a high degree of accuracy and effectiveness.

Communicates with a limited sense of audience and purpose.

Communicates with some sense of audience and purpose.

Communicates with a clear sense of audience and purpose.

Communicates with a strong sense of audience and purpose.

Application: How well did you apply your thinking skills when addressing your content; demonstrate synthesis of information; assimilate all parts of assignment and how well did you show punctuality?

Does not address higher order thinking skills, does not demonstrate synthesis of information, not able to assimilate all parts of the assignment.

Addresses beginnings of higher order thinking skills, slight synthesis of information (not enough detail), only partially assimilates all parts of the assignment. 

Addresses some higher order thinking skills, demonstrates some synthesis of information (not enough detail), does not fully assimilate all parts of the assignment.

Addresses higher order thinking skills, demonstrating synthesis of information, able to assimilate all parts of the assignment.  



submitted late by three or more days. 

submitted two days late.

submitted one day late.

submitted on time.



Overall Percentage

Teacher Comments

instructions.text:
BOH4M

Unit 2 Summative

Make a copy of this document



Learning Goals:

  • Demonstrate your learning in this unit.

  • You will create a brochure including topics discussed in this unit.

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Ontario Curriculum Expectation

  • D1. analyse the importance of planning to the success of an organization; 

  • D2.demonstrate an understanding of appropriate planning tools and techniques in a variety of situations; 

  • D3.analyse the relationship between strategic planning and the success of an organization; 

  • D4.analyse how companies respond to internal and external pressures for change;

  • D1.1 describe the planning process and its bene­ fits to the organization (e.g., flexibility, coordination, time management); 

  • D1.2 apply different problem-solving strategies to a variety of management planning challenges; 

  • D1.3 analyse the importance of individual and group creativity in planning, describe tools and strategies used in the planning process (e.g., participatory planning, benchmarking, scenario planning); 

  • D2.1 describe tools and strategies used in the planning process (e.g., participatory plan­ning, benchmarking, scenario planning); 

  • D2.2 explain the use of effective short-term planning tools and strategies (e.g., policies, operational  plans, planning approaches) and long-term planning tools (e.g., bud­ gets, strategic plans, simulations, forecasts); 

  • D2.3 demonstrate the ability to use time- management techniques.

  • D3.1 explain the importance of the strategic planning process and describe the levels of strategic planning (corporate, business, functional) in an organization;

  • D3.2 describe the types of strategic plans (e.g., growth, retrenchment, e-business) used by specific organizations; 

  • D3.3 analyse organizational strategic plans, using a variety of management tools (e.g., strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, threats analysis [SWOT analysis]; political, envi­ronmental, social, technological analysis; Porter's five forces competitive model); 

  • D3.4 analyse the two levels of corporate culture (core and observable) and describe the relationship between corporate culture and strategic planning.

  • D4.1 analyse the elements that bring about change in an organization (e.g., develop­ments in information technology, imple­mentation of a growth plan, evolution of the organizational culture);  

  • D4.2 analyse the reasons for various attitudes towards change (e.g., why individuals fear change, why individuals embrace change); 

  • D4.3 evaluate different strategies used by man­ agers  to bring about acceptance  of planned change (e.g., education, shared power, negotiation); 

  • D4.4 analyse major challenges (e.g., new tech­nologies, the influence of the Inte rn et, globalization) and  legal considerations (e.g., workplace safety standards, access for people with disabilities, pay equity) facing today's organizations.



Instructions:

  1. Choose 5 to 6 of your favorite topics in this unit.

  2. Using your chosen topics, create a 3-Fold brochure. A document such as this is used to share information on a topic. It is meant to be visual and to tell some, but not a whole lot, of information about a particular subject.

  3. You may use word, publisher or Canva for this task.

  4. If you choose to use word or publisher select one of the 3-fold brochures that are available as a template when you create a document. A template will have the general format set up for you so that you mostly have to choose pictures and text.

  5. If you prefer to use Canva, watch this tutorial.

  6. Your brochure must have a front page and back page, so you will have 6 sections to design.

  7. Place your brochure photo in the box provided below.

Front Page

Back Page

  1. Refer to the rubric to know how you will be graded.

  2. Keep a copy of this document to your course folder and notify your teacher that you have submitted your output! Good luck!

Rubric


Student Name:

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge and Understanding: How well did you show your understanding of the content of required tasks and include specified elements? How well did you demonstrate your learnings in this unit?

Demonstrates limited understanding of content of required tasks and includes few of the specified elements.

Demonstrates some understanding of content of required tasks and includes some of the specified elements.

Demonstrates considerable understanding of content of required tasks and includes most of the specified elements.

Demonstrates thorough understanding of content of required tasks and includes all of the specified elements.



Demonstrates limited learnings in this unit.

Demonstrates some learnings in this unit.

Demonstrates considerable learnings in this unit.

Demonstrates thorough learnings in this unit.

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your critical and creative thinking skills by presenting the meaning, and adding information, in creative ways when presenting your Performance Task?

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with limited use and effectiveness in analysing the case study questions.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with moderate effectiveness in analysing the case study questions.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with considerable effectiveness in analysing the case study questions.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with a high degree of effectiveness in analysing the case study questions..



Communication: How well did you communicate your information and ideas by using language effectively to convey meaning; by using a form of presentation to effectively communicate with the audience?

Communicates information and ideas with limited clarity.

Communicates information and ideas with some clarity.

Communicates information and ideas with considerable clarity

Communicates information and ideas with a high degree of clarity.



Uses language with limited accuracy and effectiveness.

Uses language with some accuracy and effectiveness.

Uses language with considerable accuracy and effectiveness. 

Uses language with a high degree of accuracy and effectiveness.

Communicates with a limited sense of audience and purpose.

Communicates with some sense of audience and purpose.

Communicates with a clear sense of audience and purpose.

Communicates with a strong sense of audience and purpose.

Application: How well did you apply your thinking skills when addressing your content; demonstrate synthesis of information; assimilate all parts of assignment and how well did you show punctuality?

Does not address higher order thinking skills, does not demonstrate synthesis of information, not able to assimilate all parts of the assignment.

Addresses beginnings of higher order thinking skills, slight synthesis of information (not enough detail), only partially assimilates all parts of the assignment. 

Addresses some higher order thinking skills, demonstrates some synthesis of information (not enough detail), does not fully assimilate all parts of the assignment.

Addresses higher order thinking skills, demonstrating synthesis of information, able to assimilate all parts of the assignment.  



submitted late by three or more days. 

submitted two days late.

submitted one day late.

submitted on time.



Overall Percentage

Teacher Comments

instructions.text:
BOH4M

2.2 Types of Plans

Make a copy of this document



Learning Goals:

  • You will differentiate between short-range and long-range plans

  • You will differentiate between strategic and operational plans and explain how they relate to one another

  • You will define policy and procedure and give examples of each.

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-

K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%




Ontario Curriculum Expectation

  • D1. Analyse the importance of planning to the success of an organization;

  • D2. Demonstrate an understanding of appropriate planning tools and techniques in a variety of situations

  • D1.1 Describe the planning process and its bene­ fits to the organization (e.g., flexibility, coordination, time management); 

  • D1.2 Apply different problem-solving strategies to a variety of management planning challenges 

  • D1.3 Analyse the importance of individual and group creativity in planning.

  • D2.1 Describe tools and strategies used in the planning process 

  • D2.2 Explain the use of effective short-term planning tools and strategies (e.g., policies, operational  plans, planning approaches) and long-term planning tools (e.g., bud­ gets, strategic plans, simulations, forecasts); 

  • D2.3 Demonstrate the ability to use time- management techniques.

Instructions:

  1. Using Canva, create a mind map.

  2. Your central theme will be “ Types of Plans”. An effective mind map help students to note down only the most important information using key words, and then make connections between facts and ideas visually – keeping all the topic thoughts together on one sheet.

  3. Here is an example of a mind-map.

  1. Be creative! You might use this output in your Unit Summative. Place your mind map in the box provided below.

  1. Answer the following question with 5-10 sentences. 

    1. Do you think your mind map gathered all the information that may be covered on an exam including class notes, textbook chapters and reading lists? If yes, how? If not, why?

Rubric

Student Name:

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge and Understanding: How well did you show your understanding of the content of required tasks and include specified elements? How well did you demonstrate your knowledge of types of plans?

Demonstrates limited understanding of content of required tasks and includes few of the specified elements.

Demonstrates some understanding of content of required tasks and includes some of the specified elements.

Demonstrates considerable understanding of content of required tasks and includes most of the specified elements.

Demonstrates thorough understanding of content of required tasks and includes all of the specified elements.



Demonstrates limited knowledge about types of plans.

Demonstrates some knowledge about types of plans.

Demonstrates considerable knowledge about types of plans.

Demonstrates thorough knowledge about types of plans.

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your critical and creative thinking skills by presenting the meaning, and adding information, in creative ways when presenting your Performance Task?

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with limited use and effectiveness in showing the types of plans.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with moderate effectiveness in showing the types of plans.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with considerable effectiveness in showing the types of plans.

Uses critical and creative thinking skills with a high degree of effectiveness in showing the types of plans.



Communication: How well did you communicate your information and ideas by using language effectively to convey meaning; by using a form of presentation to effectively communicate with the audience?

Communicates information and ideas with limited clarity.

Communicates information and ideas with some clarity.

Communicates information and ideas with considerable clarity

Communicates information and ideas with a high degree of clarity.



Uses language with limited accuracy and effectiveness.

Uses language with some accuracy and effectiveness.

Uses language with considerable accuracy and effectiveness. 

Uses language with a high degree of accuracy and effectiveness.

Application: How well did you apply your thinking skills when addressing your content; demonstrate synthesis of information; assimilate all parts of assignment and how well did you show punctuality?

Does not address higher order thinking skills, does not demonstrate synthesis of information, not able to assimilate all parts of the assignment.

Addresses beginnings of higher order thinking skills, slight synthesis of information (not enough detail), only partially assimilates all parts of the assignment.

instructions.text:
BOH4M

5.5 Ethics in the Workplace

Make a copy of this document



Learning Goals:

  • You will evaluate the impact of major ethical issues and dilemmas on management strategies and decision making.

  • You will demonstrate what you’ve learned about ethics in the workplace.

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment for Learning

Method of Assessment: Yes/No

Ontario Curriculum Expectation

  • A3. evaluate the impact of issues related to ethics and social responsibility on the management of organizations.   

  • A3.1 evaluate the impact of major ethical issues (e.g., bribery, harassment, polluting the environment, theft in the workplace, Aboriginal land claims versus interests of resource companies ) and dilemmas (e.g., for the individual, the workplace, and the local and global community) on management strategies and decision making;  

  • A3.2 explain the nature of corporate ethical and social responsibility and analyse, on the basis of research, including stakeholder analysis, a particular company’s commitment to it (e.g., in relation to non-discriminatory hiring, promotion, and retention practices; implementing the Persons with Disabilities Act and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act; environmental issues; customer/supplier relationships)




Instructions

Step 1:

Watch the video: #MeToo, #TimesUp, Now What? | Shannon Rawski | TEDxOshkosh.

Answer the questions below after watching the video above. Answer in complete sentences.

  1. Summarize the Me Too and Times Up movements as Shannon defines them.

  1. How should we prevent sexual harassment in the workplace?

  1. Is it effective? What does Shannon say from her experience?

  1. What is an “identity threat reaction”? Explain.

  1. What are the consequences of identity threat reactions to sexual harassment? Give THREE (3)  examples that Shannon talks about.

Step 2: Review

Read through your work before submitting it.

Step 3: Submit

Upload a copy of your work on your shared course folder.

BOH4M

Unit 5 Summative

Make a copy of this document



Learning Goals:

  • Demonstrate your learning in this unit.

  • You will create an infographic about CSR of your chosen organization.



Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Ontario Curriculum Expectation

  • A3. evaluate the impact of issues related to ethics and social responsibility on the management of organizations.   

  • A3.1 evaluate the impact of major ethical issues (e.g., bribery, harassment, polluting the environment, theft in the workplace, Aboriginal land claims versus interests of resource companies ) and dilemmas (e.g., for the individual, the workplace, and the local and global community) on management strategies and decision making;  

  • A3.2 explain the nature of corporate ethical and social responsibility and analyse, on the basis of research, including stakeholder analysis, a particular company’s commitment to it (e.g., in relation to non-discriminatory hiring, promotion, and retention practices; implementing the Persons with Disabilities Act and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act; environmental issues; customer/supplier relationships)



Instructions:

Socially responsible businesses are concerned about how they protect customers and treat employees and shareholders. The CoVID-19-19 pandemic offers an excellent opportunity for businesses to shift towards more genuine Corporate Social Responsibility.


  1. Think of a company you know and research about the CoVID-19 response they did for year 2020. Fill in the table below with your findings. It would be best to look into the company’s website. Below are some questions that can guide you on what to look for.

BUSINESS NAME: Coca Cola

CSR for Customers

CSR for Employees and Shareholders

CSR for Community

What are the changes in their business operation?

What programs did the company provide during the lockdown period to its employee?

Are there donations to the government or local community? How much and who benefited?

How do they secure customer’s health?

Is there a vaccination program for their employees?

Are there donations to the public and private hospitals? Is it in terms of money or medical equipment? Numbers of recipients. 

Are the new policies being implemented in all stores worldwide or regional?

Did they laid off employees or not during a lockdown? Why? How do they come up with the solution?

What is the effect of CoVID-19 on the existing CSR programs of the company?

  1. Once you have filled in the table, create an infographic using Canva or Piktochart, to present the information you gathered.

  2. View examples of infographics here: http://tinyurl.com/k7rm3eh

  3. Use the rubric below as a guide.

  4. Upload the photo of your infographic in the box below.



  1. Place your copy of this document in your shared course folder.







 Unit 5 Summative



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Student Name:

 

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge: How well did you understand the corporate social responsibility of your chosen business during CoVID-19?

Demonstrates limited understanding of the corporate social responsibility of chosen business during CoVID-19. Infographic does not include the research data.

Demonstrates some understanding of the corporate social responsibility of chosen business during CoVID-19. The infographic includes some of the research data.

Demonstrates considerable understanding of the corporate social responsibility of chosen business during CoVID-19. The Infographic includes most research data.

Demonstrates thorough understanding of the corporate social responsibility of chosen business during CoVID-19. The infographic includes all research data.

 

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your thinking in choosing the company’s CoVID-19 response for your infographic?

The research data are not related to the CoVID-19- 19 response of the company and corporate social responsibility.

A few research data are related to the CoVID-19- 19 response of the company and corporate social responsibility.

Almost all research data are related to the CoVID-19 response of the company and corporate social responsibility.

All research data are related to the CoVID-19 response of the company and corporate social responsibility.



 

Communication: How well did you communicate the information on the infographic? How well did you show the accuracy of the content?

Infographic does not include data from research or includes false data. There is no balance in graphics, titles, text and charts. Missing visual requirements to communicate

Information.

The infographic contains incomplete data from research. Graphics, titles, text and charts are somewhat not distracting. The visual somewhat communicates the Information.

The infographic contains some data from research. Graphics, titles, text and charts are almost not distracting. The visual shows good communication of information.

The infographic contains some data from research. Graphics, titles, text and charts are not distracting. The visuals show excellent communication of information.



Application: How well did you apply learnings in this lesson in explaining the information and assessing which company activities should be included? 

The data included is not related to corporate social responsibility.

The data included is somewhat related to corporate social responsibility.

Most data used is related to corporate social responsibility.

All data used is related to corporate social responsibility.

 




Overall Percentage

Teacher Comments
